name: Push_Pull
description:
*Submitted to Mark Brown's (Game Maker's Toolkit) Game Jam (2018)*

This is a 2D, top-down shooter with two key mechanics removed: shooting and direct movement.

Instead, you have two abilities: PUSH and PULL. Use these on floating projectiles to launch them towards enemies or use them on static (blue) objects to propel yourself around the arena.

---How to Play---

Controls

  • Right-click (mouse): Pull on an object
  • Left-click (mouse): Push on an object

Objects

  • Player: Green orb in center of screen
  • Enemies: Red orbs that spawn in the corners of the screen
  • Movement: Blue objects are immovable and will cause the player to Push or Pull themselves
  • Shooting: Green objects are movable projectiles; the player's movement will not be affected when Pushing/Pulling these objects

Objective

  • Enemies will mindlessly chase the player; the player dies upon contact with an enemy
  • The player can launch projectiles towards enemies to destroy them 

Note: Enemies will not be destroyed by a projectile that is moving too slowly; projectiles will be Pushed with greater force when closer to the player (Pull force is constant regardless)

---The Developers---

MrEkShun, KnightSkai, and Spoop

This is our very first project, and as such it is clearly a very rough prototype. However, we love the concept and are very, very excited to continue working on it until it is ready for a full, polished release.

***The main focus of the game will, eventually, be a 1v1 multiplayer mode. 

***If you wish to keep an eye on our progress, check back here regularly! Soon we will create some social media account to better keep in contact with our followers, even if you're the only one. ;)
